page.title: 11FISHING FROM ST.AGNES
page.content: THERE WAS ONCE A SMALL HARBOUR AT {TREVAUNANCE}TO CATER FOR THE SHIPS TRANSPORTING TIN ORE.BUT THIS HAS BEEN OVERWHELMED BY THE SEA AND ALL THAT NOW REMAINS IS A PILE OF STONES AND RUBBLE.THE ONLY BOATS WHICH NOW OPERATE FROM ST.AGNES ARE SMALL OPEN BOATS WHICH CAN BE LAUNCHED, WEATHER PERMITTING FROM THE BEACH AT {TREVAUNANCE}AND RECOVERED USING A WINCH.THE MEN WHO WORK THESE BOATS DO SO PART TIME DURING THE SUMMER, FISHING WITH POTS FOR CRABS AND LOBSTERS, OR LINES FOR POLLOCK AND MACKEREL,THE CATCHES BEING SOLD LOCALLY.SOME ST.AGNES FISHERMEN WORK LARGER BOATS IN THE ST.AGNES AREA CATCHING SHELLFISH IN "STRINGS" OF CRAB POTS BUT DUE TO THEIR SIZE THESE BOATS ARE KEPT AT NEWQUAY AND THE MEN TRAVEL DAILY.
